intro: Calceolaria annua, commonly known as the annual slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Calceolaria annua is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive blooms and relatively easy care requirements.
